string-array.name: questions_java_answers
string-array.item: Java is a platform-independent programming language
Passing itself to the method of the same class
Floating-point value assigned to an integer type

string-array.name: question_variant_java_a
string-array.item: Java is a sequence-dependent programming language
Referring to the instance variable when a local variable has the same name
Floating-point value assigned to a Floating type

string-array.name: question_variant_java_b
string-array.item: Java is a code dependent programming language
Passing itself to the method of the same class
Floating-point value assigned to an integer type

string-array.name: question_variant_java_c
string-array.item: Java is a platform-dependent programming language
Integer value assigned to floating type

string-array.name: question_variant_java_d
string-array.item: Java is a platform-independent programming language
Calling another constructor in constructor chaining
Integer value assigned to floating type

string-array.name: questions_c_answers
string-array.item: C++ supports both procedural and object oriented programming language
C++ technique to avoid multiple copies of the base class into children/derived class
The program is compiled and executed successfully
delete is used to delete single object whereas delete[] is used to multiple(array/pointer of) objects
this pointer is passed as a hidden argument in all non-static functions of a class
Based on the number of bits in the system

string-array.name: question_variant_c_a
string-array.item: C++ is an object oriented programming language
C++ technique to enhance multiple inheritance
The program is not semantically correct
delete is syntactically correct but delete[] is wrong and hence will give an error if used in any case
this pointer is passed as a hidden argument in all static variables of a class
Based on the number of bits in the system
r distinguishes between comments and inner data

string-array.name: question_variant_c_b
string-array.item: C++ supports both procedural and object oriented programming language
C++ technique to ensure that a private member of the base class can be accessed somehow
The program is compiled and executed successfully
delete is used to delete normal objects whereas delete[] is used to pointer objects
this pointer is passed as a hidden argument in all the functions of a class
distinguishes between comments and outer data

string-array.name: question_variant_c_c
string-array.item: C++ is an object oriented programming language
C++ technique to avoid multiple inheritances of classes
The program gives a compile-time error
delete is a keyword whereas delete[] is an identifier
this pointer is passed as a hidden argument in all non-static functions of a class

string-array.name: question_variant_c_d
string-array.item: C++ is a functional programming language
C++ technique to avoid multiple copies of the base class into children/derived class
The program compiled successfully but throws an error during run-time
delete is used to delete single object whereas delete[] is used to multiple(array/pointer of) objects
this pointer is passed as a hidden argument in all static functions of a class
r distinguishes between comments and outer data

resources.string: A quiz may be a game during a kind of a tricking-brain under which the players try to answer the subsequent questions being asked in several types like multiple choice, drop-down and more. It’s a game to check the person’s knowledge and skill to trick their brains on some certain subject or topic. A quiz game in some countries is alleged to be a short assessment test that needs some basic knowledge in several fields and to live the knowledge, abilities, and skills of someone in terms of percentage or marks. Quiz games are nevertheless more famous nowadays which too for a reason. It’s more important to grasp why people need more and more of it and what reasonable quizzes they have. People nowadays wish to challenge themselves and their friends with their knowledge and skills. Through these quizzes, people test their knowledge level, and also daily, they will examine themselves and grow regarding their knowledge and that they examine more if there’s a competitor out there to beat them up!\nThis program was created in the 11th lesson by Murodullayev Muhammad, an android bootcump student of GITA Academy of Programmers.
